intro: Bouvardia rekoi, commonly known as the pink bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a trailing plant, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Bouvardia rekoi is popular in floral arrangements due to its delicate appearance and long-lasting blooms.
